tool_description: uNoGS (unofficial Netflix online Global Search) allows anyone to  search the global Netflix catalog.
title: uNoGS

api_list.name: /static/genres
api_list.description: Get Static list of Genres (updated daily)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://unogs-unogs-v1.p.rapidapi.com/static/genres"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "unogs-unogs-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

utterances.utterance: Show me the list of all Netflix genres available worldwide.
What are the current Netflix genres updated today?
Give me the static list of Netflix genres that is updated daily.
List all the genres Netflix offers globally right now.
Can you provide the updated daily genres list from Netflix's global catalog?
Fetch the static genres list for Netflix that is refreshed every day.
I want to see all the Netflix genres available worldwide as of today.
Get me the daily updated static list of Netflix genres.
What genres does Netflix have globally according to the latest update?
Provide the current static list of Netflix genres updated daily.

api_list.name: /search/titles
api_list.description:
Parameter Notes:
new_date will either take a single date and check for all titles added after that date or it will take 2 dates separated by a comma to check titles added between them.

parameters.name: end_rating
parameters.description: number between 1 and 10, aligns with imdb rating, if there is one

parameters.name: country_list
parameters.description: CSV list of country IDs e.g. 46,78

parameters.name: start_year
parameters.description: year date > 1900

parameters.name: person
parameters.description: name of person in title

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: where you want the response to start e.g. 10 starts with the 10th element

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Order of Response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit of object returned

parameters.name: end_year
parameters.description: year date > 1900

parameters.name: top250
parameters.description: IMDB top 250 Movies number 0-250

parameters.name: start_rating
parameters.description: number between 1 and 10, aligns with imdb rating, if there is one

parameters.name: top250tv
parameters.description: IMDB top 250 Series number 0-250

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: search all titles by name

parameters.name: expiring
parameters.description: if 'true' show all titles set to expire

parameters.name: subtitle
parameters.description: name of subtitle language e.g. english

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: movie or series

parameters.name: genre_list
parameters.description: CSV list of genres, see misc/genre endpoint

parameters.name: audio
parameters.description: name of audio language e.g english

parameters.name: audio_sub_andor
parameters.description: and=language in bot audio and sub, or=language in either audio or sub

parameters.name: country_andorunique
parameters.description: and=titles in all countries, or=any title in these countries, unique=unique titles in chosen countries

api_list.name: /search/people

parameters.name: person_type
parameters.description: what the person did on the project

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit of object returned

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: search all titles by name

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: where you want the response to start e.g. 10 starts with the 10th element

api_list.name: /search/deleted
api_list.description:
Search for Deleted Titles by Country or Title Name
delete_date will either take a single date and check for all titles added after that date or it will take 2 dates separated by a comma to check titles added between them.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://unogs-unogs-v1.p.rapidapi.com/search/deleted"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "unogs-unogs-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: search all titles by name

parameters.name: netflix_id
parameters.description: actual netflix ID for the title e.g. 70143836 for Breaking Bad

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit of object returned

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: where you want the response to start e.g. 10 starts with the 10th element

parameters.name: country_list
parameters.description: CSV list of country IDs e.g. 46,78

api_list.name: /static/countries
api_list.description: Get Static list of Supported Countries
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://unogs-unogs-v1.p.rapidapi.com/static/countries"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "unogs-unogs-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())
